snippet: Unleash your inner artist with a new category of pen display tablets, ones that won’t clean out your bank account.
lead_paragraph: Much of the iPad's magic -- and its success -- comes from the directness of the touch screen. For decades, you dragged a mouse on one surface to make the cursor move on another. And now, suddenly, you can tap or draw right on the screen. But at places like Pixar and Marvel, they've been happily drawing on their screens since 1992. That's when Wacom released its first pen display -- its first draw-on-the-screen tablet -- for artists.

headline.main: The Joy Of Drawing On Glass
